description: This course uses major schools of economic thought and major economic writers from the past 600
years to introduce principles of economics.  Readings include the architects of capitalism (Adam
Smith, David Ricardo, etc.), the critics (Karl Marx, Thorstein Veblem, etc.), and the reformers
(J.M. Keynes, Joseph Schumpeter, J.K. Galbraith, etc.).  Offered many Interims.
